Title: The Green Hornet

Cast: Christoph Waltz, Cameron Diaz, Seth Rogen, Edward Furlong, Edward James Olmos, Tom Wilkinson, Jay Chou, Sterling Cooper, Chad Coleman, Analeigh Tipton
Rating: Not recommended for children under 7 years 


Synopsis: 
Britt Reid (Seth Rogen) is the son of tycoon media most prominent and respected in Los Angeles and is happy to lead a pointless existence of partying until his father (Tom Wilkinson) dies mysteriously, leaving the command Britt of his vast media empire. Britt strikes up an unlikely friendship with Kato (Jay Chou), one of the smartest employees and ingenious of his father, and together they discover the opportunity for the first time in their lives to do something with purpose: to fight crime. To get closer to the criminals, create the perfect cover: pose as criminal. Protect the broken law, and Britt and becomes the vigilante The Green Hornet and Kato and his friend out to protect the streets.
 
Using all his ingenuity and ability, Kato retro builds advanced weapon: Black Beauty, an indestructible car with firepower and horsepower equally. Circulating in a mobile fortress on wheels and attacking the bad guys with the clever devices of his companion, the names of Green Hornet and Kato are beginning to be on everyone's lips and with the help of Lenore Case, Britt's new secretary, set out the search of the man who controls the underworld of Los Angeles: Benjamin Chudnofsky (Christoph Waltz). But Chudnofsky has its own plan: Green Hornet crush once and for all.
 
Production notes: 
Based on the comic of the same name, created by George W. Trendle.
